subject: Education
title: Algorithmic Bias in EdTech
description: A fast breakdown of Algorithmic Bias in EdTech for builders.

hook.text: An algorithm denied a student college admission. The reason? Her zip code predicted low success.

buildup.text: EdTech algorithms increasingly decide who gets resources, recommendations, and opportunities.

discovery.text: These systems train on historical dataâ€”data that reflects decades of existing inequalities.

twist.text: Bias amplifies: students labeled 'low potential' get easier content and fewer chances to excel.

climax.text: Without careful auditing, algorithms automate and scale human prejudice across millions of students.

punchline.text: An algorithm is only as fair as the data and people who built it.

quiz.question: How can algorithmic bias affect students in EdTech?
options: Students labeled 'low potential' receive easier content and fewer opportunities
Algorithms always produce perfectly fair and unbiased outcomes
Bias only affects students in computer science courses
